qas.question: Who commented on New York that "culture just seems to be in the air, like part of the weather"?
In what library can the book New York, culture capital of the world, 1940–1965 be found?
What institution of higher education has described New York as the cultural capital of the world?
Along with Latvia, the consulate of what country has called New York the cultural capital of the world?

context: New York City has been described as the cultural capital of the world by the diplomatic consulates of <a3_0>Iceland<a3_0/> and Latvia and by New York's <a2_0>Baruch College<a2_0/>. A book containing a series of essays titled New York, culture capital of the world, 1940–1965 has also been published as showcased by <a1_0>the National Library of Australia<a1_0/>. In describing New York, author <a0_0>Tom Wolfe<a0_0/> said, "Culture just seems to be in the air, like part of the weather."
